channel.title: Music on Randy Ridenour
channel.description: Recent content in Music on Randy Ridenour

item.title: The Ballad of Mitch Randall
item.description: (Sung to the tune of “John Henry”) When Mitch Randall was a little baby, sitting on his father’s knee. He tied a ribbon on his finger, and he held it in the air. Said, this bow tie’s gonna be the death of me, Lord, Lord This bow tie’s gonna be the death of me. When Mitch Randall was just a little boy, his parents noticed that he was an unusual child.

item.title: Greatest Beatles Songs?
item.description: Rolling Stone’s ranking of the top ten Beatles songs.

item.title: The Monads
item.description: From the “Thoughts, Arguments, and Rants” blog, here is a link to a band called “The Monads” and it’s reincarnation, “The 21st Century Monads.” No educated person could resist songs with titles like “The Skeptic Song” and “The Missing Shade of Blues.” There’s even a song expressing the emotional depths of the academic life: “My Paper Was Rejected Again.”
